course_title: Contextual Education Elective: Bible and Health
class_notes: (Concurrent enrollment in CE 552ANGb, TPb, 552b required; permission number required to enroll; request permission by contacting candlerregistrar@emory.edu prior to pre-registration) (ON CAMPUS)
course_description: Health is central to all members communities at individual, communal, country, regional & global levels. Recent global pandemics underline interconnectedness & the centrality of shared health. As a normative text, biblical perspectives on health matter. This course seeks to explore various definitions & theories of health. It will investigate the link between Earth-justice, political stability, social justice; & the health of individuals & communities. Explorations of biblical understanding of health will be drawn from various biblical texts & put in conversation with contextual placements.
schedule_location: Th 2:30pm-5:30pm in Rita Anne Rollins Building_250
sections: Class Nbr: 5657, Section #: 1, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: Th 2:30-5:30p, Instructor: M. Dube, Status: Open
